DESCRIPTION: Chest pain type (typical angina, atypical angina, non-angina, or asymptomatic angina)
Fasting blood sugar (< 120 mg/dl or > 120 mg/dl)
Resting electrocardiography results (normal, ST-T wave abnormality, or left ventricular hypertrophy)
Max. heart rate achieved during thalium stress test
ST depression induced by exercise relative to rest
Slope of peak exercise ST segment (upsloping, flat, or downsloping)
Number of major vessels colored by fluoroscopy
Thalium stress test result (normal, fixed defect, or reversible defect)
Heart disease status: number of major vessels with >50% narrowing (0,1,2,3, or 4)
